New Records: Shai Gilgeous-Alexander and Chet Holmgren each scored 29 points, setting a new record for the Thunder in the game.
Key Match Events: The game was tied at 31 early in the second quarter before the Thunder dominated from there, outscoring the Rockets 41-20 in the period to take a 75-51 lead at halftime.
The Thunder shot 61.9% from the field and 52.9% from 3-point range in the first half.
Pre-Game Insights: The Thunder opened a six-game homestand with a victory after losing at Denver on Wednesday night for their first defeat of the season.
The Thunder had been inconsistent on offense so far this season but figured things out in this game.
The Thunder's defensive performance was highlighted as they shut down Houston's top two scorers, Jalen Green and Alperen Sengun.
Post-Match Reflections: Oklahoma City's depth and versatility were too much for the Rockets, with Holmgren being a key factor on both ends.
The Thunder's offensive performance was strong, making 20 of 23 free throws and shooting 51.1% from the field.
The Rockets struggled offensively, shooting just 43.3% from the field.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game was a season-high point total for a half for the Thunder.
The Thunder's victory was their eighth straight, moving them to 8-1 on the season.
The Rockets are now 5-4 on the season.
Others: The Thunder's win marked a crucial step toward their championship aspirations.
The game was tied early but the Thunder's dominance from that point on led to their victory.
The Thunder's defensive strategy was effective in containing Houston's top scorers.
